channel.title: [Tutorial] Change the client Java cup icon to any Icon [Noob Friendly]
channel.description:
[b]I'm not sure if there is a tutorial for this already, so don't comment anything stupid. I'm not very good at English & I don't really know what "Noob friendly" is but it seems like it's for noobs who can't understand anything :P - xknightpk [/b] [size=16pt][b]How to change the java cup icon to an icon of your choice![/b][/size] change the client image to any other of your choice, in only 3 simple steps; or two if you're not an idiot ;) Client types tested on : [i]PI[/i], tell me if any other works.
[b]Step 1: Finding the .java file.[/b] Look around the client files & find [code]Jframe.java[/code]
[b]Skip to part 2 if you found it[/b] If you can't find it you're probably using delta or try searching by pressing [code]ctrl F[/code]
[b]Step 2: Modifying the Jframe.java[/b] Find something similar to [code=c]frame = new JFrame("CLIENTNAMEHERE");[/code] Under that you paste this [code=c]String imgURL = "./ICONS/ICONNAME.png" frame.setIconImage(new ImageIcon(imgURL).getImage());[/code]
[i]Note:[/i] [code]//the first line gets the image //the second line sets the gotten image to the icon of the client[/code]
[b]Step 3: Adding your image to the client.[/b] Change the [code=c]"./ICONS/ICONNAME.png"[/code] of course to [b]YOUR[/b] image location.
[center][b]Compile, and you're done![/b][/center]
[i]Note[/i] [code]You might have to change the image location due to the fact that the person that downloads your client would have a different location of where the image is, therefor not loading the image.[/code]
[i]Note[/i] [code]Remember if you're using an image other than .png, change the Jframe.java code you've put, to the image file you're using.[/code]
[b]I did this mainly for reamm28, but for me as well. Post your icon pictures to bump this & so I can see :p. There's already a tut? I'll delete this. Any problems? Message me.
Images[/b] [img]http://i1081.photobucket.com/albums/j349/Mariano_FlyyBucci/rv.png[/img] [img]http://i1081.photobucket.com/albums/j349/Mariano_FlyyBucci/img.png[/img]

item.title: [Tutorial] Change the client Java cup icon to any Icon [Noob Friendly]
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“s1gma, post:3, topic:445351”]fuck off with the absolute and windows-specific paths.

should just be something like

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/1.5.0/docs/api/java/io/File.html#separator
even better!

Read full topic

item.title: [Tutorial] Change the client Java cup icon to any Icon [Noob Friendly]
item.dc:creator: @jake.bellotti jake.bellotti
item.description:
@jake.bellotti wrote:

Good tut, worked for me. You may also wan to state that “Gui.java” is in some servers like mine. and also:
To get the image:

String imgURL = (sign.signlink.findcachedir()+"/Sprites/image.PNG"); frame.setIconImage(new ImageIcon(imgURL).getImage());
Is also a good option if you want to load the image from your cache.

Read full topic

item.title: [Tutorial] Change the client Java cup icon to any Icon [Noob Friendly]

item.description:
@xknightpk wrote:

I’m not sure if there is a tutorial for this already, so don’t comment anything stupid. I’m not very good at English & I don’t really know what “Noob friendly” is but it seems like it’s for noobs who can’t understand anything - xknightpk

[size=16pt]How to change the java cup icon to an icon of your choice![/size]
change the client image to any other of your choice, in only 3 simple steps; or two if you’re not an idiot
Client types tested on : PI, tell me if any other works.

[b]Step 1: Finding the .java file.[/b]

Look around the client files & find

Skip to part 2 if you found it
If you can’t find it you’re probably using delta or try searching by pressing

[b]Step 2: Modifying the Jframe.java[/b]

Find something similar to

Under that you paste this

String imgURL = "./ICONS/ICONNAME.png" frame.setIconImage(new ImageIcon(imgURL).getImage());

Note:

//the first line gets the image //the second line sets the gotten image to the icon of the client

[b]Step 3: Adding your image to the client.[/b]

Change the

of course to YOUR image location.

[center]Compile, and you’re done![/center]

Note

You might have to change the image location due to the fact that the person that downloads your client would have a different location of where the image is, therefor not loading the image.

Note

[b]I did this mainly for reamm28, but for me as well. Post your icon pictures to bump this & so I can see :p. There’s already a tut? I’ll delete this. Any problems? Message me.

Images[/b]
